hi anyone has an idea of how to properly implement a custom account in Android?
I don't really get how it works
docs not helping me either
I've implemented one but i think its not enough
Conceptually, I am asking for user login credential (I don't store password in the AccountManager) We use tokens btw
and then after the user login, then user closed the app and returns back again, I want the user to still login
what I did is I store the user info like name, email, (no password), and the token into the cache
retrieve the email from it and query account manager and retrieve the token from the manager
*like name, email, (no password), I don't store the token into the cache
Now I have a problem with this approach though, just clearing the app files on settings > clear app data just simply remove the cached email
my app doesn't have the email to query the account manager for the token, so the user appeared to be logged out. Meanwhile, on my Account Settings, the User still logged on.
Also where should I stored cached user data (e.g. names, email etc.)? Without having to worry about Settings > Application > Clear App Data?
i don’t think you can work around Clear App Data. If I clear my app data, I WANT the app to be just like it was when I first installed it
So where can I properly store cached user data?
alright account manager addExplicitAccount(account, password, userData) has a third param of type Bundle
I can put userData here and retrieve it via AccountManager#getUserData(Account, Key)
